    This class is a reference of localized and common strings

      • useLanguage

      • getUsedLanguage

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Language getUsedLanguage()

      • get

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @NotNull
public @NotNull java.lang.String get(@Nullable
                                                                    @Nullable java.lang.String key)
        Returns a string with the given key. If the key starts with lang., a dictionary search is performed. If the key is not found in the primary dictionary (that is, by default, the currently used language file), then it's searched in the backup dictionary (that is, by default, English (US)). If the key starts with string., the string is searched in the common strings reference. If it's not found anywhere, the function returns the key
        Parameters:
        key - dictionary key of the string
        Returns:
        • a string from the dictionary if the key was found
        • the key itself if the key wasn't found
        • "null" string if the key was null

      • get

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @Nullable
public @Nullable java.lang.String get(@Nullable
                                                                      @Nullable java.lang.String key,
                                                                      @Nullable
                                                                      @Nullable java.lang.String fallbackValue)
        Returns a localized string from a given key. If not found in primary dictionary (that is, by default, the currently used language file), then searches in the backup dictionary (that is, by default, English (US)). If nothing is found in both, returns the fallback value
        Parameters:
        key - dictionary key of the string
        fallbackValue - the fallback value
        Returns:
        • a string from the dictionary if the key was found
        • the fallback value if the key wasn't found or was null

      • get

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @NotNull
 @SafeVarargs
public final @NotNull java.lang.String get(@Nullable
                                                                                        @Nullable java.lang.String key,
                                                                                        Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>... placeholders)
        Returns a string with the given key. If the key starts with "lang.", a dictionary search is performed. If the key is not found in the primary dictionary (that is, by default, the currently used language file), then it's searched in the backup dictionary (that is, by default, English (US)). If the key starts with "string.", the string is searched in the common strings reference. If it's not found anywhere, the function returns the key. Finally, replaces all first values specified in the pairs of the variadic argument to the second values of these pairs
        Parameters:
        key - dictionary key of the string
        placeholders - Pairs of two strings - the placeholder key and the replacement value
        Returns:
        • a string from the dictionary if the key was found
        • the key itself if the key wasn't found
        • "null" string if the key was null
